citations.narrative:
*The facility currently exhibits a young female camel (an exotic hoofstock species), along with domestic livestock species,
without a valid USDA license as identified on photos posted on the facility’s social media and website pages. A
conversation with the facility’s owner confirmed that the camel was being exhibited as the owner thought that camels were
considered a domestic livestock species. The facility is also raising and selling yak, an exotic hoofstock species.
*A valid license is necessary to protect the health and well-being of the animals and to comply with the Animal Welfare
Act and Regulations.
*The facility needs to obtain a USDA license or discontinue regulated activities including exhibiting and selling exotic
hoofstock species.
This search inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the facility owner.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility owner.
n

narrative:
2.1(a)(1) 
   
Requirements and application. 
*The facility currently exhibits a young female camel (an exotic hoofstock species), along with domestic livestock species, 
without a valid USDA license as identified on photos posted on the facility’s social media and website pages. A 
conversation with the facility’s owner confirmed that the camel was being exhibited as the owner thought that camels were 
considered a domestic livestock species. The facility is also raising and selling yak, an exotic hoofstock species.  
*A valid license is necessary to protect the health and well-being of the animals and to comply with the Animal Welfare 
Act and Regulations.  
*The facility needs to obtain a USDA license or discontinue regulated activities including exhibiting and selling exotic 
hoofstock species.  
 
This search inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the facility owner. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility owner.
